org.edg.data.replication.optorsim
Class SimpleComputingElement

java.lang.Object
  org.edg.data.replication.optorsim.SimpleComputingElement
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable, ComputingElement
Direct Known Subclasses:
BatchComputingElement
public class SimpleComputingElement
extends java.lang.Object
implements ComputingElement

The ComputingElement runs a thread which executes the GridJobs given to it through its JobHandler. For each file required, the ComputingElement calls getBestFile(), which returns the location of the best replica of the file according to the chosen optimisation algorithm, which may or may not have performed replication. The ComputingElement reads the file from this location and processes it. The time to process the file is calculated as the time specified in the parameters file divided by the number of worker nodes in the ComputingElement.

Each ComputingElement can currently run only one job at a time. Information on the time taken for each job can be found in the statistics output at the end of the simulation if statistics level 3 is selected in the parameters file, or from the job time histograms if the GUI is used.

Copyright (c) 2002 CERN, ITC-irst, PPARC, on behalf of the EU DataGrid. For license conditions see LICENSE file or http://www.edg.org/license.html

Since:
JDK1.4

run

public void run()
When running, the ComputingElement processes all the jobs submitted to it through the JobHandler, sleeping while the JobHandler is empty. It is notified to shut down by the ResourceBroker.
